songs.description: this is my favorite song of all time? slowdive has always been one of my favorites and when this was released it cemented itself in my heart. the chorus of “kisses / born desert sun” makes me feel like that meme of the kid crying with headphones on every time.
this song pumps me up like no other because i am in fact a hot girl, a pop girl, a rich girl, a bitch girl and you just wanna be me.
very good breakup song - heartbreak! disappointment! resentment! messy feelings!!
sorry has a special clunky, grungy sound that sounds like indie rock sibling of micachu + the shapes that i was immediately taken with and can’t wait to see how their sound evolves.
objectively an incredibly important song for american music. i want a life and love that sounds like this and cannot wait to blast this while driving through the desert.

this song is about the power + beauty of first loves and losses. it transports me right back to high school summer nights hanging out with my crush in a park with all the yearning, anxiety, unknowns and naive hope.
only a shadow captures an angst, maybe an anger that almost feels empowering and exciting.
giving up, giving in, acknowledging the struggle. this song carries a painful memory but the feeling of surrender is cathartic and the imagery of the lyrics stays with me.
this is what i play when i’m home alone with a bottle of wine and can blast the stereo.
it’s ethereal, it’s sexy, it’s groovy what else do you want?

songs.songname: I Was Dancing In The Lesbian Bar
songs.description: never ceases to put me in a good mood - feels like a summer evening in los angeles
got dragged to an absolutely terrible bar in bushwick for an italo-disco night but ended up dancing my ass off for hours and left with this song stuck in my head.
apparently this song is about the vietnam war but idc, it’s the crazy bitch in love anthem.
bar italia was truly the soundtrack to my year. i ended up seeing them two nights in a row in november because i’m obsessed but also because one of the guitarists is the hottest man i have ever seen.
i loove mary jane dunphe’s voice and the bassline is epic
beirut will always hold a very special place in my heart and this is the song that cuts to my core.
beautiful painful ballad of lost love (specifically to adrianne lenker) there is a feeling of desperation and exasperation that makes it especially vulnerable.
my go to “don’t fuck with me song”

songs.songname: Don’t Let Me See You Swing & Miss
songs.description: beautiful, poetic and dark kiwi band. the whole album just feels like a coming of age love story in a strange place.

molly nilsson’s lyrics hit so close to home and gun control is the right song for looking back on the year. her sparse yet catchy sound and subject matter sounds like what trying to figure things out in your mid twenties in a big city is like.
